children.subject: There will be open sitting at the Greek, therefore yes you an ignore the seating number on your tickets.
While it's stated that there's no reserved seating, the tickets that I ordered online have seat numbers on them. So, should we ignore the seat numbers on the tickets?
Name/Reader cards were giving out with your graduation gift.  If you didn't pick-up a graduation gift, you will receive a name/reader card at Commencement on Thursday.
Where do I get a name card?
Wait, it's expected to be raining but we can't bring umbrellas?
Will the ceremony be webcast? Either live or afterwards?
Can someone confirm EECS ugrad reception details?

history.content:
Hello All-

 

This is a gentle reminder for those of you who plan to attend the L&SCS Commencement today.  Please arrive at the Greek Theatre - South Side at 1:00 p.m.  If you plan to attend the reception after the ceremony at Memorial Glade please wear sensible shoes since it may be muddy after the rain we've been having. Also, we will have Name/Reader cards on site however, if you received one already, remember to bring it with you today.

 

See you then!  Please see my original email below.

 

Best,


Charlene

************************************************************************

Hello CS Graduating Class of 2019-

 

Below you will find information regarding logistics for the CS Commencement.  The Commencement will take place rain or shine. 

 

Congratulations!  We'll meet you at the Greek Theatre at 1:00 p.m. on Thursday May 23rd! Check our website for updates at:

 

https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/commencement 

********************************

 

NAME CARD:   DO NOT LOSE YOUR NAME CARD. This will be read when you walk across the stage, if your name is difficult to pronounce, please write it out phonetically.  We will collect these cards and give them to GradImages, our photographers, please fill out both sides of the card.  BRING THIS CARD WITH YOU TO COMMENCEMENT.

 

SECURITY CHECK/METAL DETECTORS: All patrons entering the Greek Theatre will be required to walk through metal detectors at the entrances to the venue. Please ensure that you arrive early enough to allow for this new security step and to ensure that you are in your backstage and ready for the commencement on time! Please let your guests know to arrive early as well.

 

TICKETS:  Tickets for guests can be purchased for a fee of $5 through Cal Performances online, over the phone at 510-642-9988, and at the Ticket Office at Zellerbach Hall (Tues-Fri, 12 p.m. - 5:30 p.m., Sat-Sun, 1 p.m. - 5:00 p.m.).  Tickets will be sold at the venue on the day of the event beginning one hour before your ceremony until one hour after the published start time. 

 

Everyone, with the exception of graduates wearing regalia, must have a ticket to enter the Greek. There is no reserved seating; seats are available on a first come, first served basis.

 

ARRIVAL TIME: Please arrive at 1:00 p.m. SHARP (no Berkeley time) to the backstage area of the Greek Theatre so that we can give you final instructions before the ceremony begins.  The ceremony will begin promptly at 2:00 p.m.  We estimate that the ceremony will last 2 hours. You will enter through the North Gate by the ticket booth. .

 

RECEPTION: The reception will follow the ceremony, at approximately 4:15 pm. It will be at the Memorial Glade with refreshments for you and your guests.

 

STUDENT SEATING: You will be seated in the U-shaped center of the pit area. You can sit in any order.

 

SPECIAL SEATING/ADA ACCOMMODATIONS: Special seating sections are reserved for guests in wheelchairs or who have difficulty with the stairs, or any other mobility and access issues.  We recommend guests be at the Greek Theater at 1:00 p.m. when the doors open. Guests requiring accommodations should enter on the Southside of the Greek. We kindly ask that large parties split up to ensure special seating for anyone who needs it.

 

ADA seats are clearly marked in the venue and are available on a first-come, first-serve basis in the individual seating bays. Other guests in your party are welcome to sit in the bleacher seats behind the reserved ADA area. We can only ensure one companion seat per disabled guest, but we will do our best to seat your entire party together.

 

You may park at the Underhill Parking Garage (Channing Way between Bowditch St. and College Ave.); a wheelchair-accessible shuttle for guests who need mobility assistance will operate between the Underhill garage and the stadium. (The shuttle will stop at the Channing Way entrance.) Please note that guests drop off will NOT be allowed at Gate 6; only designated shuttles will be allowed to stop there.

 

Shuttle service is also available to guests around the Berkeley campus, free of charge for graduating seniors wearing cap and gown or with ID as well as their families. You may catch a Bear Transit shuttle eastbound near the Downtown Berkeley BART station. Shuttles stop at Addison/Shattuck and Hearst/Euclid and run every 12–24 minutes. View the Bear Transit page for transit information, shuttle schedules, and route maps.

 

********************************

The following items are PROHIBITED inside the Greek Theatre:

  •  LARGE BAGS OR BACKPACKS
  •  GLASS BOTTLES / ALUMINUM CANS
  •  ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES
  •  COOLERS / ICE CHESTS
  •  BABY STROLLERS (designated parking is available inside)
  •  SKATEBOARDS / BICYCLES / SCOOTERS
  •  MUSICAL INSTRUMENTS
  •  FIREWORKS
  •  NOISE-MAKERS / AIRHORNS
  •  ROLLS OF TOILET PAPER
  •  BALLOONS (may be tied-off at the entrance gates at owners' discretion)
  •  UMBRELLAS
  •  SIGNS / BANNERS / FLAGS
  •  TRIPODS FOR CAMERAS
  •  ANIMALS (with the exception of documented service animals)
  •  LAWN FURNITURE OR CHAIRS (small blankets, cushions, and low-backed stadium seats are OK)
  •  ANY ITEMS THAT CAN BE PERCEIVED A WEAPON

There is no bag or coat check available. All bags are subject to search. Thank you for your cooperation. 

Best wishes!

  •  UMBRELLAS

#pin
